newsitem.title: USA: Abbott's Depacon cleared for epilepsy. [CORRECTED 23:49 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Abbott's Depacon cleared for epilepsy. [CORRECTED 23:49 GMT]

text.p: Abbott Laboratories Inc said Tuesday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has cleared Depacon (valproate sodium injection) for the temporary treatment of certain types of epilepsy.
It said the entry of Depacon expands Abbott's broad line of anticonvulsant products. Depacon is available as an intravenous formulation.
Depacon is indicated as an intravenous alternative in patients for whom oral administration of valproate products is temporarily not feasible in certain conditions.

Abbott (corrects from "Baxter") said about 2.5 million people in the United States have some form of epilepsy. The broad coverage Depacon brings to valproate products will offer a convenient treatment alternative to those who may be temporarily unable to take oral medication, it said.
Abbott is a global, diversified health care company.
